bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Located near the town of Warren in southern Albemarle County, Virginia, Ballenger Creek became a Baptist church in the late eighteenth or early nineteenth century. The church dissolved sometime after 1865.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The first book, "Old Church Book up to Nov. 1856," contains membership lists of white, enslaved, and free Black members, rules for church government, and meeting minutes for May 1846 - January 1847 and March 1847 - May 1856.

The second book begins in October 1852 and contains rules for church government, a roll of white members (November 1856), and church meeting minutes for September 1856 - May 1859 and July 1859 - July 1863.
